properties.areaDesc: Mono; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 2:47AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
There will be potential travel impacts across northern Sierra
passes on Tuesday with a few inches of snowfall expected as a
weaker end winter storm arrives.

Snow levels on Tuesday will generally remain between 5500-6000
feet with snowfall accumulations of 2-5 inches possible on
northern Sierra passes (Donner Summit, Echo Summit, Carson Pass)
with about 1-2 inches possible for Fredonyer, Brockway, Mt Rose,
and ridges across Mono County. Accumulations near Lake Tahoe level
and Mammoth Lakes look generally less than an inch.

Initial snow onset Tuesday across western Lassen county will be
around 4-6am, then across the Tahoe Basin about 8-10am with the
best potential mid-Tuesday afternoon into the early evening.

Across western Nevada, this system will largely be shadowed out
with the exception of far northern Washoe County near the Oregon
border where up to a tenth of an inch of rainfall is possible.

This will be more of a wind maker for the lower valleys with wind
gusts of 35-45 mph across the Tahoe Basin and along the US-395
and I-580 corridor from Walker northward. Winds may result in
hazardous boating conditions across area lakes and possible travel
restrictions for high profile vehicles where cross winds are
present.

NWSheadline: Gusty Winds, Snowfall on Sierra Passes Tuesday
